messages.message: On these icons the For 10-K and Resume Parser designs don’t match the other icons, are these the final icons? Also Converse and Build seems bigger than the others as they have less whitespace around them than the other icons.

Thanks for the feedback.

1. Form 10-K is a provisional one, we will make it uniform with the Form W-2.
2. re: resume parser - what stands out for you? does it make sense for the app itself? 
3. re: converse and build icons - the less whitespace is intentional. we wanted them to stand out from other apps.
Ok thanks! For the resume parser, the content of the icon is what i’d expect, but the colours / design is different from the others. The others are a lot more colourful and don’t have a border.

Hi Varun, If i can, i'd add to the feedback re the sizing of Converse and Build. I agree with Lee, currently they look bigger and out of sync with the rest. Although *you* know they are like that on purpose to stand out, that might not be obvious to other users, who then may just think it looks messy. Could you consider highlighting them in another way... Either with a border or shadow or having them in a section of their own "featured Apps".
I would consider changing the way you want to highlight them so its more obvious to users, rather than looking like the sizing is off.
Hope that helps.
I agree with Anna, its only slightly off so doesn’t look like an intentional highlight, it looks like a mistake.

icons on converse and build: agree that they look bigger, we can make them smaller.

i don't think resume parser and form 10-k use our icons. we can look into that.
Good catch - the padding/ sizing is slightly off will fix.
